titles.title: As Longs the Deer for Cooling Streams

comments.comment: This hymnal has not been proofed - data may be incomplete or incorrect

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: As longs the deer for cooling streams in parched and barren ways, so longs my soul, O God, for Thee and Thy refreshing grace.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: For Thee, my God, the living God, my thirsty soul doth pine: O when shall I behold Thy face, Thou majesty divine?

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Why restless, why cast down, my soul? Hope still, and thou shalt sing the praise of Him who is thy God, thy healthâ€™s eternal spring.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: To Father, Son, and Holy Ghost, the God whom we adore, be glory as it was, is now, and shall be evermore.
